Package jaengine.modules.physics

Class Collisions

  • java.lang.Object
    • jaengine.modules.physics.Collisions
  • public class Collisions
extends Object
    A static class that determiens the direction and the magnitude of a collision force

    • Method Detail

      • findImpulse

        public static double findImpulse​(double massA,
                                 Vector2D velA,
                                 double massB,
                                 Vector2D velB,
                                 Vector2D bNorm,
                                 double res)
        Determine the magnitude of the impulse in a collision. ALL CREDIT FOR THIS FORMULA GOES TO https://gamedevelopment.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-custom-2d-physics-engine-the-basics-and-impulse-resolution--gamedev-6331 None of my formulas worked nearly as well as this one
        Parameters:
        massA - the Mass of the first object
        velA - the velocity of the first object
        massB - the mass of the second object
        velB - the velocity of the second object
        bNorm - the normal direction to be used in the collision from the perspective of B. This is equivalent to the normal force from A's perspective reversed.
        res - the coefficient of restitution between teh two objects
        Returns:
        the magnitude of the collision

      • findDirection

        public static Vector2D findDirection​(HashMap<Integer,​Integer> lines,
                                     Hitbox hb)
        Determine the direction to apply the force in. Parameters must refer to the same object in question
        Parameters:
        lines - the lines involved in the collision
        hb - the hitbox of the object
        Returns:
        a vector of magnitude 1 that determiens the direction to apply the force in
